KH.content: es gibt always implicated in negative theology (in its Christian history?); what there is, there, is not; p. 97 there is khōra, but the khōra does not exist [importance of article]
KH.linkedContent: es gibt always implicated in negative theology (in its Christian history?); what there is, there, is not; p. 97 there is khōra, but the khōra does not exist [importance of article]

KH.content: khōra beyond ontological, to give place w/out donor-subject giving something to someone [GT]
KH.linkedContent: khōra beyond ontological, to give place w/out donor-subject giving something to someone [GT]

GOD.content: one must suppress the object of the gift, to keep in the gift only the giving
GOD.linkedContent: one must suppress the object of the gift, to keep in the gift only the giving

GT.content: [re: Madame de Maintenon (Maintenant)] desire as desire to give what one cannot give, pour le pouvoir de donner
GT.linkedContent: [re: Madame de Maintenon (Maintenant)] desire as desire to give what one cannot give, pour le pouvoir de donner

GT.content: “it gives (ça donne),” not an utterance in propositional structure of Greek-Latin grammar
GT.linkedContent: “it gives (ça donne),” not an utterance in propositional structure of Greek-Latin grammar

GT.content: Heidegger: to look ahead (vorblicken) to the It (Es) which gives (gibt) Being (Sein) & time (Zeit), we try to bring the It and its Being into view, capitalize the “It”, become foresighted
GT.linkedContent: Heidegger: to look ahead (vorblicken) to the It (Es) which gives (gibt) Being (Sein) & time (Zeit), we try to bring the It and its Being into view, capitalize the “It”, become foresighted

GT.content: the es gibt plays (spielt), play of 4’s as play of gift, manifests the unity of time’s 3 dimensions, la donne de ce jeu [relance], & la doña, la femme qui nous a requis depuis l’exergue [Derrida then mentions a fine book, Finas’ Donne, which interlaces all these themes]
GT.linkedContent: the es gibt plays (spielt), play of 4’s as play of gift, manifests the unity of time’s 3 dimensions, la donne de ce jeu [relance], & la doña, la femme qui nous a requis depuis l’exergue [Derrida then mentions a fine book, Finas’ Donne, which interlaces all these themes]

GT.content: “there is gift,” not the same as “the gift exists”  [ontological difference?]
GT.linkedContent: “there is gift,” not the same as “the gift exists” [ontological difference?]

GT.content: most serious stake of political economy: certain social classes have more time than others; but time cannot be given, it is certainly not time that they possess
GT.linkedContent: most serious stake of political economy: certain social classes have more time than others; but time cannot be given, it is certainly not time that they possess

GT.content: Derrida thinking gift by way of idiomatic expressions: give a class, donner une facilité, donner le change [hunting expresson], etc.
GT.linkedContent: Derrida thinking gift by way of idiomatic expressions: give a class, donner une facilité, donner le change [hunting expresson], etc.

GT.content: Husserl’s donating intuition (gebende Anschauung): principle of principles

“give time (day, life)” is to give nothing: one sees blurred lines btwn transcendental & conditioned, the fold of undecidability that permits all values to be inverted: to give life is to give death (i.e. strange crossing of idioms: “se donner le mort” means “to take one’s life [in English]”)
GT.linkedContent: “give time (day, life)” is to give nothing: one sees blurred lines btwn transcendental & conditioned, the fold of undecidability that permits all values to be inverted: to give life is to give death (i.e. strange crossing of idioms: “se donner le mort” means “to take one’s life [in English]”)

GT.content: narrative gives possibility of impossibility of story as story of gift or forgiveness
GT.linkedContent: narrative gives possibility of impossibility of story as story of gift or forgiveness

GT.content: Heidegger uses formula “to give what one does not have” (like Lacan)
GT.linkedContent: Heidegger uses formula “to give what one does not have” (like Lacan)

MONL.content: fatal precipitation of promise dissociated from will, intention, meaning-to-say [vouloir-dire], heralds uniqueness of language to came, “there is…” implies “it doesn’t exist”
MONL.linkedContent: fatal precipitation of promise dissociated from will, intention, meaning-to-say [vouloir-dire], heralds uniqueness of language to came, “there is…” implies “it doesn’t exist”

MONL.content: gift of language remains only on condition that it still remains to be given
MONL.linkedContent: gift of language remains only on condition that it still remains to be given

FL.content: deconstruction is possible as an experience of the impossible, wherever one can replace, translate, determine the X of justice, wherever there is (the undeconstructible)
FL.linkedContent: deconstruction is possible as an experience of the impossible, wherever one can replace, translate, determine the X of justice, wherever there is (the undeconstructible)

AF.content: [re: Yerushalmi] he doesn’t mean to give but to give back, a masterly decipherment, give back to Freud his own competence [to read Hebrew]
AF.linkedContent: [re: Yerushalmi] he doesn’t mean to give but to give back, a masterly decipherment, give back to Freud his own competence [to read Hebrew]

SPOM.content: “how does the concern w/ what there is to be (qu’il y a à être) [Heidegger] intersect, in order perhaps to exceed it, with the logic of vengeance or right?”
SPOM.linkedContent: “how does the concern w/ what there is to be (qu’il y a à être) [Heidegger] intersect, in order perhaps to exceed it, with the logic of vengeance or right?”

POR.content: reflect on reflection, seize inaudible in sort of poetic telephony, “hear” hearing > this time of reflection is heterogeneous to what it reflects, gives time, chance of event
POR.linkedContent: reflect on reflection, seize inaudible in sort of poetic telephony, “hear” hearing > this time of reflection is heterogeneous to what it reflects, gives time, chance of event

HERP.content: for Heidegger, ear is poetic (dichtende), hears in advance what it causes to burst forth, elle donne elle-même à entendre ce qu’elle entend [a heart?]
HERP.linkedContent: for Heidegger, ear is poetic (dichtende), hears in advance what it causes to burst forth, elle donne elle-même à entendre ce qu’elle entend [a heart?]

HASD.content: radically nonhuman, atheological, khōra is not the es of giving (es gibt), before all subjectivity, doesn’t create/produce, not even an event [avoid anthropo-, theomorphic schemas]
HASD.linkedContent: radically nonhuman, atheological, khōra is not the es of giving (es gibt), before all subjectivity, doesn’t create/produce, not even an event [avoid anthropo-, theomorphic schemas]

HASD.content: khora, neither an event nor a giving, neither an order nor a promise, the wholly other (tout autre), neither transcendent, absolutely distanced, nor immanent and close
HASD.linkedContent: khora, neither an event nor a giving, neither an order nor a promise, the wholly other (tout autre), neither transcendent, absolutely distanced, nor immanent and close

MPM.content: [re: de Man closer to Heidegger than he thinks] for Heidegger, memory too, like promise, gathers near what can come, toward the “future” > es gibt never gives anything in present, it calls as a promise; Heissen (“to call, ” “to command” > entrust, keep safely)
MPM.linkedContent: [re: de Man closer to Heidegger than he thinks] for Heidegger, memory too, like promise, gathers near what can come, toward the “future” > es gibt never gives anything in present, it calls as a promise; Heissen (“to call, ” “to command” > entrust, keep safely)

MPM.content: “always necessary to excuse oneself for giving,” given its risk of its being in annulled in thanks, given that it never arrives in present
MPM.linkedContent: “always necessary to excuse oneself for giving,” given its risk of its being in annulled in thanks, given that it never arrives in present

VM.content: Levinas describes es gibt as neutral unity of existence
VM.linkedContent: Levinas describes es gibt as neutral unity of existence

VM.content: for Levinas, w/out the irruption of tout-autre, internal consciousness could not se donner le temps nor [give itself] the absolute alterity of every instant
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, w/out the irruption of tout-autre, internal consciousness could not se donner le temps nor [give itself] the absolute alterity of every instant

VM.content: for Levinas, Western philosophy has been an ontology where Reason receives only what it gives itself
VM.linkedContent: for Levinas, Western philosophy has been an ontology where Reason receives only what it gives itself

VM.content: following Levinas, what would a language w/out phrase offer the other? a master who forbids himself the phrase gives nothing, has no disciples, only slaves
VM.linkedContent: following Levinas, what would a language w/out phrase offer the other? a master who forbids himself the phrase gives nothing, has no disciples, only slaves

POOF.content: Plotinus’ “give what you don’t have” > receiving a giving? joy of mother not needing to be known (Aristotle) [loving vs. being loved]
POOF.linkedContent: Plotinus’ “give what you don’t have” > receiving a giving? joy of mother not needing to be known (Aristotle) [loving vs. being loved]

POOF.content: “O my friends…” a call, a promise, a prayer (eukhé) [neither true nor false, Aristotle] > can’t give friendship, were friendship not still to come [Heideggerian ek-stasis] > in the name of friendship, “no friend” respectfully declares the perfect sovereign friendship impossible
POOF.linkedContent: “O my friends…” a call, a promise, a prayer (eukhé) [neither true nor false, Aristotle] > can’t give friendship, were friendship not still to come [Heideggerian ek-stasis] > in the name of friendship, “no friend” respectfully declares the perfect sovereign friendship impossible

PAS.content: to give must forget all the way up to what is given, one gives without having self (sans s’avoir) [see p. (23) say “come” w/out knowing, having, seeing]
PAS.linkedContent: to give must forget all the way up to what is given, one gives without having self (sans s’avoir) [see p. (23) say “come” w/out knowing, having, seeing]

A.content: via Seneca & Diderot, one would guard jealously one’s time above all else; to “master” “my life” > know difference btwn giving one’s time & wasting one’s time
A.linkedContent: via Seneca & Diderot, one would guard jealously one’s time above all else; to “master” “my life” > know difference btwn giving one’s time & wasting one’s time

SH.content: the resistance thought of “once” gives one to think, let’s let ourselves be approached by this offering
SH.linkedContent: the resistance thought of “once” gives one to think, let’s let ourselves be approached by this offering

SH.content: date es gibt, annulment at work when date inscribes its here and now in iterability, consigns itself to self-forgetfulness, succeeds in effacing itself
SH.linkedContent: date es gibt, annulment at work when date inscribes its here and now in iterability, consigns itself to self-forgetfulness, succeeds in effacing itself

P.content: beautiful object, tulip, not lacking in anything, tel point de vue, de but en blanc, plie la totalité à se manquer elle-même > le sans de la coupure pure est sans manque—but for me to experience its totality, my knowledge lacks something—its end (bout); not the absence of end but the trace of the without [end] is origin of beauty; ça donne-le-beau: beauty gives nothing to be seen, sans is not visible, et pourtant il y en a et c’est beau
P.linkedContent: beautiful object, tulip, not lacking in anything, tel point de vue, de but en blanc, plie la totalité à se manquer elle-même > le sans de la coupure pure est sans manque—but for me to experience its totality, my knowledge lacks something—its end (bout); not the absence of end but the trace of the without [end] is origin of beauty; ça donne-le-beau: beauty gives nothing to be seen, sans is not visible, et pourtant il y en a et c’est beau

ROP.content: double bind drives deconstruction in rhythmic compulsion to track desire for origin, and to raise its stakes, la pousse à une surenchère > interminable drama of analysis, il fallait faire droit to the law deconstructed, w/ une affirmation donatrice unknown to yet driving analysis
ROP.linkedContent: double bind drives deconstruction in rhythmic compulsion to track desire for origin, and to raise its stakes, la pousse à une surenchère > interminable drama of analysis, il fallait faire droit to the law deconstructed, w/ une affirmation donatrice unknown to yet driving analysis

SP.content: Heidegger’s giving of the gift cannot be thought of in terms of Being (neither subject nor object), not in Being’s horizon, nor truth, nor meaning; no essence of es gibt, no essence of woman or sexual difference > can’t apprehend/oppose to gift of Being a determined gift (whether body, subject, sex—la femme n’aura donc pas été mon sujet)
SP.linkedContent: Heidegger’s giving of the gift cannot be thought of in terms of Being (neither subject nor object), not in Being’s horizon, nor truth, nor meaning; no essence of es gibt, no essence of woman or sexual difference > can’t apprehend/oppose to gift of Being a determined gift (whether body, subject, sex—la femme n’aura donc pas été mon sujet)

SP.content: like woman, like writing: il se donne en se dérobant
SP.linkedContent: like woman, like writing: il se donne en se dérobant

SW.content: veil given by God, and giving here is ordering (donner c’est ici ordonner)
SW.linkedContent: veil given by God, and giving here is ordering (donner c’est ici ordonner)

Gii.content: Heidegger’s es gibt goes beyond question of meaning of Being, w/out overturning it
Gii.linkedContent: Heidegger’s es gibt goes beyond question of meaning of Being, w/out overturning it

Gii.content: since, for Heidegger, essence of hand is not in its prehension, it’s also not in Hegelian grasping of Begriff, taking hold by mastery/manipulation > what is hand’s essence?: the gift, give w/out taking anything
Gii.linkedContent: since, for Heidegger, essence of hand is not in its prehension, it’s also not in Hegelian grasping of Begriff, taking hold by mastery/manipulation > what is hand’s essence?: the gift, give w/out taking anything

Gii.content: in Benveniste, “Exchange & Gift,” which Derrida referenced in GT, nothing less assured than distinction btwn giving/taking: bad & good gift (gift/Gift or pharmakon)
Gii.linkedContent: in Benveniste, “Exchange & Gift,” which Derrida referenced in GT, nothing less assured than distinction btwn giving/taking: bad & good gift (gift/Gift or pharmakon)

Gii.content: hand gives & gives itself: animal rationale can only take, grasp
Gii.linkedContent: hand gives & gives itself: animal rationale can only take, grasp

Gii.content: Derrida sees Heidegger’s reflections on as such [re: borderline btwn man/animal] as similar to his reflections on the hand, ability to give or take as such [see p. 43]
Gii.linkedContent: Derrida sees Heidegger’s reflections on as such [re: borderline btwn man/animal] as similar to his reflections on the hand, ability to give or take as such [see p. 43]

REST.content: [Derrida’s “thesis”]: il y a shoes, neither present nor absent
REST.linkedContent: [Derrida’s “thesis”]: il y a shoes, neither present nor absent

REST.content: rendering homage [restitution?] is difficult, because of the “interminable outbidding of an analysis which is never finished tying together,” > and yet, il y a hommage, ça donne
REST.linkedContent: rendering homage [restitution?] is difficult, because of the “interminable outbidding of an analysis which is never finished tying together,” > and yet, il y a hommage, ça donne

REST.content: praise for Heidegger’s Es gibt, Sein starting from (returning to) Es gibt Sein
REST.linkedContent: praise for Heidegger’s Es gibt, Sein starting from (returning to) Es gibt Sein

REST.content: Artaud (protests against ghosts): no ghosts in Van Gogh, no visions, the torrid truth, hieroglyphics > Derrida cautions: “you can only give them [the ghosts] back (rendre) if you think you have them, and you can only think you’re giving them if you haven’t got them”]
REST.linkedContent: Artaud (protests against ghosts): no ghosts in Van Gogh, no visions, the torrid truth, hieroglyphics > Derrida cautions: “you can only give them [the ghosts] back (rendre) if you think you have them, and you can only think you’re giving them if you haven’t got them”]

REST.content: don’t have to render anything: just bet on the trap like others swear (jurent) on a Bible > il y aura eu à parier, ça donne à rendre, a remmettre [there will be something to bet, it gives…] ——if faudrait “rendre” encore, donc, en se séparant, et même en laissant tomber [even in letting the matter drop, we’d render (something?)] [can’t tell the difference btwn imperative & no choice]
REST.linkedContent: don’t have to render anything: just bet on the trap like others swear (jurent) on a Bible > il y aura eu à parier, ça donne à rendre, a remmettre [there will be something to bet, it gives…] ——if faudrait “rendre” encore, donc, en se séparant, et même en laissant tomber [even in letting the matter drop, we’d render (something?)] [can’t tell the difference btwn imperative & no choice]

RM.content: withdrawal of Being donne lieu to metaphysics, ontotheology, producing concept of metaphor, producing/calling itself in a quasi-metaphorical manner
RM.linkedContent: withdrawal of Being donne lieu to metaphysics, ontotheology, producing concept of metaphor, producing/calling itself in a quasi-metaphorical manner

RM.content: not opposed to metaphor but will limitlessly extend/load (chargera) any metaphoric trait w/ supplementary surplus value; re-trait (at once +/–), double movement of being
RM.linkedContent: not opposed to metaphor but will limitlessly extend/load (chargera) any metaphoric trait w/ supplementary surplus value; re-trait (at once +/–), double movement of being

RM.content: can’t say trait is, it conditions the ontological copula—like es gibt
RM.linkedContent: can’t say trait is, it conditions the ontological copula—like es gibt

PSSS.content: originary affirmation, which advances itself in advance, lends [?] rather than gives itself?
PSSS.linkedContent: originary affirmation, which advances itself in advance, lends [?] rather than gives itself?

D.content: nothing says present better, it seems, than il y a; but what is present is a scission, il y a cette coupure, what is present & at work is a “recoil (recul),” possibility of its triggering
D.linkedContent: nothing says present better, it seems, than il y a; but what is present is a scission, il y a cette coupure, what is present & at work is a “recoil (recul),” possibility of its triggering

D.content: this [re: Numbers] reinscription (writing, a machination) takes place (a lieu), il y a sa violence
D.linkedContent: this [re: Numbers] reinscription (writing, a machination) takes place (a lieu), il y a sa violence

C.content: little princeps coffin is not given, not a prior given that would be natural, autochthonous: “models,” examples, referents (usually are)
C.linkedContent: little princeps coffin is not given, not a prior given that would be natural, autochthonous: “models,” examples, referents (usually are)

C.content: paradigm as revenge: le mort se venge, “model” is always le revenant rêvé: haunting does not befall it, but takes the first step (la hantise ne lui survient pas, elle donne le premier pas)
C.linkedContent: paradigm as revenge: le mort se venge, “model” is always le revenant rêvé: haunting does not befall it, but takes the first step (la hantise ne lui survient pas, elle donne le premier pas)

C.content: there is the gift (es gibt) and there is what I couldn’t give: I want to keep it better than ever
C.linkedContent: there is the gift (es gibt) and there is what I couldn’t give: I want to keep it better than ever

TN.content: il y a la (là) du tact > given as given as much as ordered (do touch but avoid contact)
TN.linkedContent: il y a la (là) du tact > given as given as much as ordered (do touch but avoid contact)

TN.content: w/out playing on words, never: il faudrait donc entendre et tendre tendrement ces mots—tender, tend, extend > “Tiens!”: “Take (Prends)!” (tender it, à tendre on sous-entend) is not “I give you (je te donne)” (obscene phrase: assumed certainty, expected recognition)
TN.linkedContent: w/out playing on words, never: il faudrait donc entendre et tendre tendrement ces mots—tender, tend, extend > “Tiens!”: “Take (Prends)!” (tender it, à tendre on sous-entend) is not “I give you (je te donne)” (obscene phrase: assumed certainty, expected recognition)

TN.content: “Tiens!”: that the other grasp or seize, keep what one extends to him, giving to “touch”
TN.linkedContent: “Tiens!”: that the other grasp or seize, keep what one extends to him, giving to “touch”

TN.content: philosophy—idealization, intuitionism as philosophy itself, where seeing the blind spot, a point, is touching it > fullness of immediate presence: actuality of what se donne en acte, energetically, effectively: hapto-tropologic metaphysics comes to its plenitude, pleroma
TN.linkedContent: philosophy—idealization, intuitionism as philosophy itself, where seeing the blind spot, a point, is touching it > fullness of immediate presence: actuality of what se donne en acte, energetically, effectively: hapto-tropologic metaphysics comes to its plenitude, pleroma

TN.content: Nancy: phenomenology touches/exceeds its own limit in Cartesian Meditations > “pré-donation of the alter-ego”
TN.linkedContent: Nancy: phenomenology touches/exceeds its own limit in Cartesian Meditations > “pré-donation of the alter-ego”

TN.content: for Didier Franck (cf. Chair et corps), flesh as a pre-given of time; Derrida asks why would that which is always given in time need to precede it?
TN.linkedContent: for Didier Franck (cf. Chair et corps), flesh as a pre-given of time; Derrida asks why would that which is always given in time need to precede it?

TN.content: touch is quasi-transcendental-ontologization, quasi because touchable of touch gives itself over as untouchable (se donne comme intouchable)—figuring, fictionalizing itself
TN.linkedContent: touch is quasi-transcendental-ontologization, quasi because touchable of touch gives itself over as untouchable (se donne comme intouchable)—figuring, fictionalizing itself

ATM.content: re: Levinas, “astriction to giving” complicates quoted utterance “here I am,” what is said only once, what exceeds not the saying but the said in language
ATM.linkedContent: re: Levinas, “astriction to giving” complicates quoted utterance “here I am,” what is said only once, what exceeds not the saying but the said in language

CIN.content: cinder, nothing that can be in the world, remains beyond everything that is (konis epekeina tēs ousias), giving itself (es gibt ashes)—it’s nothing
CIN.linkedContent: cinder, nothing that can be in the world, remains beyond everything that is (konis epekeina tēs ousias), giving itself (es gibt ashes)—it’s nothing

CIR.content: writing w/out believing in one’s survival, in the inheritance of the last will, writing for the present, a made present, like SA wants to make truth: I don’t take my life, je me donne ici la mort
CIR.linkedContent: writing w/out believing in one’s survival, in the inheritance of the last will, writing for the present, a made present, like SA wants to make truth: I don’t take my life, je me donne ici la mort

EU.content: Derrida continues to believe in the interest in light re: university, a task that remains for us given-to (donné-à), to what I don’t know (one might have once said: to doing or thinking)
EU.linkedContent: Derrida continues to believe in the interest in light re: university, a task that remains for us given-to (donné-à), to what I don’t know (one might have once said: to doing or thinking)

EU.content: thought of sendoff (envoi), dispensation or gift of being: one of most powerful/singular attempts to think history/structure of onto-theology: Shickung, Schicksal, Gabe, “es gibt Sein,” “es gibt Zeit” do not seem to belong w/in onto-theological philosophemes
EU.linkedContent: thought of sendoff (envoi), dispensation or gift of being: one of most powerful/singular attempts to think history/structure of onto-theology: Shickung, Schicksal, Gabe, “es gibt Sein,” “es gibt Zeit” do not seem to belong w/in onto-theological philosophemes

SPEC.content: [re: fort/da]: selbstgeschaffene (self-invented) game, spontaneity, auto-production, self-engendering of repetition itself, hetero-tautology (definition of Hegelian speculative): gives time, there is time
SPEC.linkedContent: [re: fort/da]: selbstgeschaffene (self-invented) game, spontaneity, auto-production, self-engendering of repetition itself, hetero-tautology (definition of Hegelian speculative): gives time, there is time

SPEC.content: same step (pas) [Freud’s step beyond PP] gives & suspends movement, es gibt, exemplary movement of paralysis [Derrida repeating too, cf. FSW, PAS] [démarche]
SPEC.linkedContent: same step (pas) [Freud’s step beyond PP] gives & suspends movement, es gibt, exemplary movement of paralysis [Derrida repeating too, cf. FSW, PAS] [démarche]
